a: Full-time students aged 18+ from any discipline may apply. Limited places exist for recent graduates within 12 months.
Attendance is free. We cover meals, workspace, Wi-Fi, and loan hardware. You cover travel and accommodation.
Teams of up to four. You can register with a team or join the mixer on Friday evening to find collaborators.
We supply microcontrollers, sensors, fabrication tools, and lab access. Bring personal laptops and any specialist kit you prefer.
Judges score on technical depth, user impact, and clarity of demo. Final presentations are five minutes plus questions.
Participants retain full ownership of anything they create. Sponsors and the university receive no automatic rights.
We enforce the Hack Code of Conduct plus university safeguarding rules. Breaches mean removal from the event.
Yes. Step-free access, lifts to all floors, accessible toilets, prayer room, and quiet zones are available.
We provide meals from Friday evening to Sunday lunch, plus snacks and hot drinks. Dietary requirements are captured during sign-up.
Take tram or bus to Oxford Road, then follow signage to Nancy Rothwell Building. Limited cycle parking is available on-site.
